span.strong: Notice - Sample Ballot - Brochure - Superintendent Letter
- Kindergarten Screening Information: Update - Registration Form - Flyer

div.span: - Elementary Playground Project: The Manhattan PTO is currently running a campaign seeking to raise funds to build two new and inclusive playgrounds on the school campus. To read more and to donate to this project see their GoFundMe page.
- Free School Lunches now available for everyone! Pick up on Monday will be at the elementary kitchen parking lot. See more details on the Manhattan School Lunch Facebook page.

strong.img: Watch here for Coronavirus (COVID-19) updates and information from school officials. It will be updated regularly in the coming days with newest items dated and at the top of the list.

li.span: April 7th: Governor Bullock extends closures to April 24th. Video Link
April 7th: School Nurse #4 - Accurate Information and For Kids, a fantastic youtube video from a school nurse in Wisconsin based on current scientific evidence about COVID-19.

span.strong: April 3rd: Video Greetings from the HS Staff! Be Happy!

li.span: April 3rd: Mr Slater Newsletter with details on the end of the quarter.

span.strong: March 31st: Support and Suggestions from the School Nurse #3
March 27th: Support and Suggestions from the School Nurse #2

li.span: March 26th: MPS Covid-19 Plan of Action adopted at March 26th Board Meeting

em.a: Support and Suggestions from the School Nurse #1

a.strong: Mr Slater Covid-19 update from the high school

li.span: March 20th: Parent Communication Letter with details on online instruction and pickup and dropoff of materials.
March 18th: Administrative Team Letter detailing plan for delivery of instruction.

March 16th: 5-8 Yearbooks are being prepared but they must be ordered by March 29. See the Yearbook Flyer for the school code and pass the word around about the deadline. For your convenience, here is the Lifetouch Link and our school code is 13952320

span.strong: Sunday, March 15th, Governor announces closure of Montana schools for two weeks.
Sunday, March 15th, Superintendent Letter addressing closure.

strong.a: Video Message from Ms Maggie Secrest, MPS School Nurse

li.span: March 3rd Message from school nurse:In response to recent worldwide concerns over the spread of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), we would like to strongly encourage everyone, especially travelers, to take the following precautions ...Message Continued

div.span: - Employment: The school has positions open for this school year. Please consider joining our awesome team! Check out the employment link to see current postings. Also, Harlow's bus service is looking for drivers. See this Harlow's Flyer for details.

You are now able to make your online lunch payments through the student/parent portal. You should have received details on how to setup and use your Infinite Campus account. You can certainly always make payments by cash or check at either school office.

table.summary: Contact List for Manhattan School District

tr.th:
K-4 Principal
Title IX Coordinator
Homeless Liaison

div.span: The Manhattan School District website is designed to provide equal access information to all members of the Manhattan Community. Contact the Superintendent at (406) 284-6460 regarding questions about the functionality of, or content on the website that is inaccessible. Information on filing a formal grievance with the District pursuant to the requirements of Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act 1990 can be found by clicking the "Federal and Montana Legal Notices" link under Quick Links. Policy 1700 Uniform Complaint Procedure can be found under the District Tab by selecting School Board Information, then selecting "Board Policies." This information may also be obtained by contacting the Superintendent at (406) 284-6460.
